file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 77-41-03-04 - EVM BOX - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EVM BOX - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedure to remove/install the EVM. There is only one EVM box for the LH and RH engines. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 77-41-03-000-801-A EVM - REMOVAL ALL 77-41-03-400-801-A EVM - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 77-41-03 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 77-41-03-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. EVM - REMOVAL A. General (1) The EVM is installed in the rear electronic compartment. To remove the EVM, obey the instructions below. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 272 272DR Rear electronic compartment D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially To get access to the rear electronic compart- Ladder available ment E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Rear electronic compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the VIB IND circuit breaker and attach DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to it. (2) Put the ladder in position, and open the rear electronic compartment door 272DR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 77-41-03 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Get access to the rear electronic compartment, and loose the nuts (3). (2) Remove the EVM (1) from tray (2). (a) Install a protective cap to the EVM connector. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 77-41-03 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL EVM - Removal/Installation Figure 401 B A ZONES 273 274 DET. A 1. E.V.M. 2. TRAY 1 3. NUT 1 DET. B HAND TIGHT TORQUE 4. BOLTS 1 3. NUT 145AMM770002.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 77-41-03 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 77-41-03-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. EVM - INSTALLATION A. General (1) To install the EVM, obey the instructions below. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM TASK 77-41-03-700-801-A/500 EVM - OPERATIONAL TEST C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 272 272DR Rear electronic compartment D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially To get access to the rear electronic compart- Ladder available ment E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Rear electronic compartment I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Remove the protective cap from EVM connector. (2) Install the EVM (1) on its tray (2). (3) Install the bolts (4) and nuts (3) on its position. See figure 401 for torque values. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 77-41-03 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Close the door 272DR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100), and remove the ladder. (2) Remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag and close the VIB IND circuit breaker. (3) Do the EVM test procedure (AMM TASK 77-41-03-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 77-41-03 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
